answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
Bob, your reservations are well founded.  Indeed, if there is a trend, albeit somewhat weak, it is the opposite which is to separate economic and community development functions from planning.  The short answer to why it doesn't work is to stack up the qualifications, qualities, and duties of a planner, against those of an economic developer.  While there will be clear evidence of connectivity between the two core functions, there will not be much cross over.  May be too over simplistic but a planner plans and an economic developer implements.

author: Bob Connelly
text: Can anyone point me towards a successful example of the combined position of City Planner/Economic Development Director? My city is considering such a position and I have serious reservation about it being a practical solution.
title: Combining City Planner & Economic Development Positions
